ygData.subject: Re: A bit off topic but...
ygData.msgSnippet: Speaking of compasses, and since we re off topic anyways... : ) Has anyone  bought and used a compass? It d be helpful to know if it gives out the same
ygData.messageBody:
Speaking of compasses, and since we're off topic anyways... : )

Has anyone bought and used a compass? It'd be helpful to know if it gives
out the same information as the old /loc command. If so, I'm going and
buying one right now. I've been a little lax in mapping stuff, and places
like unrest are a pain in the ass to find because it's not near the water,
and not all the way up the mountain.

Zalabar
14th Wizard
Solusek Ro

-----Original Message-----
From: mstokes <mstokes@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: 22 avril, 1999 11:24
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: A bit off topic but...


>From: mstokes <mstokes@...>

>I'm only level 7 but I did notice, during my travels, that the third
windmill in
>steamfont is a good place to start.
>
>I've heard you can make compasses and collapsable fishing poles, and
compasses
>comand quite a premium on the market (good bye sense heading).
>
>Does anybody know the advantages of the collapsable fishing pole?
>What else can you make?
>
>By the way tinkering was my sole reason for creating a gnome.
>
>Malkin
>
